Definition: \forall e1, e2, d1, d2 \, ( Entity(e1) \land Entity(e2) \land Capability(d1) \land Vulnerability(d2) \land has(e1, d1) \land has(e2, d2) \land exploits(d1, d2) \rightarrow  Threat(e1) \land Asset(e2) \land threatens(e1, e2))
Description: For all entities e1 and e2, and for all capabilities d1 and vulnerabilities d2, if e1 is an entity, e2 is an entity, d1 is a capability, d2 is a vulnerability, e1 has the capability d1, e2 has the vulnerability d2, and the capability d1 exploits the vulnerability d2, then it follows that e1 is a threat, e2 is an asset, and e1 threatens e2.
